document_data.name: Xan
document_data.mainbody:
'''Xan''' was an [[elven]] [[enchanter]] and member of the [[Greycloaks]] of [[Evereska]] during the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].<ref group="note">In the [[Baldur's Gate (novel)|''Baldur's Gate'' novel]] Xan is not a [[mage]] nor said to be a member of the Greycloaks. During the story he is killed by a [[giant spider]] in the [[Cloak Wood]] forest.
{{Quote|Life is so hollow.|Xan}}

Personality.Abilities: Due to his preferred [[school of magic]], Xan's [[enchantment]] spells were more potent. As a result however, he was incapable of casting spells from the school of [[evocation]].

document_data.Relationships: Xan's cousin [[Erevain]] was actually quite fond of him.
document_data.Possessions: His most treasured possession was his ''[[Xan's moonblade|moonblade]]'', a [[magic]]al sword that was forged in the fabled city of [[Myth Drannor]].
document_data.History: Sometime during or before the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, Xan was tasked by the Greycloaks to investigate the [[iron crisis]] that befell the region of the [[Sword Coast]]. He was eventually caught by the [[cleric]] [[Mulahey]] and imprisoned within the [[Nashkel mines|mines]] beneath [[Nashkel]].
